project1.heading: Implementation of Distributed Key-Value Store for a P2P Network
project1.introContent: Implemented a scalable key-value store using the Chord Protocol for decentralized networks. The Chord Protocol simplifies key lookup, node joining, and leaving processes, ensuring consistent behavior.

project2.heading: Raft Consensus Algorithm Implementation
project2.introContent: Developed a replicated state machine using Raft, a distributed consensus protocol, to ensure log consistency across replicas in the system.

roles.roleHeading: 3DExperience SOLIDWORKS Drafting & MBD Software Engineering Manager
roleDesc: Working on the MBD and Drawing Application xDrawing.
Responsible for generating tools for annotating the CAD models in both 3D and 2D Views.
Full stack application dealing with Three.js, Webgl etc.
I was involved in the research and development of SIMULIA suite of products, which provide simulation solutions for various engineering and multiphysics problems.
My primary focus is on advancing computational geometry algorithms for 3D surface modeling and mesh processing in PowerFLOW and PowerDELTA.

Conducted research on mesh datasets and experimented with different approaches to enhance mesh quality post-boolean operations. Developed and implemented enhancements to the offsetting algorithm, resulting in improved mesh quality.
Contributed to maintaining the legacy code by templatizing C++ code and creating component libraries.
Developed computational geometry and mesh modification features for multiphysics simulation preprocessing software HyperMesh.
My primary focus was on enhancing the Connectors toolbox in HyperMesh, which models connections like welds, rivets, etc., between two parts.
Developed and implemented features to improve surface mesh quality, detect proximity components, join and disjoin components, and stitch surface meshes for the Connectors toolbox.
Designed and implemented a robust C++-based regression testing suite for BatchMesher.
